question.title: Override parent class swagger annotations
question.body:
This is my parent class:

    public abstract class Measurement {
        @Schema(description = "The value", example = "1")
        public Double amount;
        @Schema(description = "The unit", example = "m")
        public String unit;
..
    }

Then I have another class extending it like this:

public class Weight extends Measurement {
...
}

The problem I am having is that in the generated swagger docs, the Weight class has the 1 m. Which is incorrect, of course, since weight should not be a length. Is there a way to override the parent schema annotation somehow? For example in the Weight class I would like to do something like this:

@Schema(description = "The weight",
        example = "kg",
        allowableValues = {"g", "hg", "kg", "lb"})

@Schema(description = "The value",
        example = "2")

but still inheriting the Measurement class.
